intro: Psychotria rupicola, commonly known as the rock psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. This plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, dark green leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found growing in rocky or disturbed habitats, which contributes to its common name.
